thread.title: 98-year-old Sister Jean thanks God for Loyola-Chicago's win

title: 98-year-old Sister Jean thanks God for Loyola-Chicago's win
text:
98-year-old Sister Jean thanks God for Loyola-Chicago's win 1:58pm GMT - 00:59 
Sister Jean Dolores-Schmidt, the 98-year-old team chaplain and honorary assistant coach for Loyola-Chicago's basketball, says ''God was the difference'' as the Chicago team advanced to the Elite Eight after a 69-68 victory over seventh-seeded Nevada on Thursday. Rough Cut (no reporter narration). ▲ Hide Transcript ▶ View Transcript
